Development of an Application Programming Interface (API) to automate downloading and processing of precision livestock data Chapter 1 About

Development of an Application Programming Interface (API) to automate downloading and processing of precision livestock data Jameson R. Brennan1, Ira Parsons1*, Meredith Harrison2, and Hector Menendez III1 2024-02-16 Chapter 1 About Advances in sensor technology have ushered in the ability to collect vast amounts of data in real-time for animal production systems. Though there is much promise in improving animal monitoring production and research utilizing precision systems, for this technology to be truly impactful, data generated needs to accessed and processed in near real time for relevant decision making. In this paper, three application programming interfaces were developed to facilitate near-real time data access. In addition open-source tutorials were developed to generate summary statistics of three precision livestock technologies and systems checks to ensure equipment is working properly and animal adoption rates of technology are adequate for data collection. The development of data processing outlined in this paper will be essential for successful implementation of precision technology and integration of data in real time with animal nutrition or decision making algorithms.
